oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Leila Shute Tigert and Mary Rhea Cooper with sheep
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Leila Shute Tigert and Mary Rhea Cooper with sheep at Grassmere. Leila is standing behind the fence looking down towards the sheep, while Mary stands in front of the fence with a doll in her arms. Written on the back is "Lelia [sic] Shute Tigert and Girl Mary Ray [sic] Cooper."

Mary Rhea Cooper (1911-1938) was the daughter of Amelia Townsend Tigert (1891-1928) and Ernest Bonner Cooper (1869-1951). Dr. Holland Tigert and Leila Shute Tigert, her mother's uncle and aunt, adopted Mary sometime after her parents divorced. Mary lived at Grassmere with the Tigerts until her death.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Sheep; Women; Girls
